attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LZpW-eaFoVfu8h9wzHK_description
attribs.current: You're acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet. You're also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LZpXzp98aWRxqqujV7w_description
attribs.current:
In battle, you fight with primal ferocity. On your turn, you can enter a rage as a bonus action.

While raging, you gain the following benefits if you aren't wearing heavy armor:

You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

When you make a melee weapon attack using Strength, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll. This bonus increases as you level.

You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

If you are able to cast spells, you can't cast them or concentrate on them while raging.

Your rage lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked unconscious or if your turn ends and you haven't attacked a hostile creature since your last turn or taken damage since then. You can also end your rage on your turn as a bonus action.

Once you have raged the maximum number of times for your barbarian level, you must finish a long rest before you can rage again. You may rage 2 times at 1st level, 3 at 3rd, 4 at 6th, 5 at 12th, and 6 at 17th.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LZpXzpE8C6xMWH81BgD_description
attribs.current: While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LZpYy29Yzkpufh3gMuo_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d12, Damage Type: Slashing,Secondary Damage: 2,Secondary Damage Type: rage

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LZpadLVg-a8teLtsTxY_itemcontent
attribs.current: This pouch of cosmetics, hair dye, and small props lets you create disguises that change your physical appearance. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any Ability Checks you make to create a visual disguise.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LZpanNxdoZSOf5ePKPe_itemcontent
attribs.current:
If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.

A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus, substituting it for any material component that does not list a cost.

Each type of musical instrument requires a separate proficiency.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LZpbkmIndBG6SxZxTqT_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Slashing, Range: 20/60

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LZpbuSjYmS1ZrbZiLqN_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Includes:

• a backpack

• a bedroll

• a mess kit

• a tinderbox

• 10 torches

• 10 days of rations

• a waterskin

• 50 feet of hempen rope

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LZpcDBeOgzcuprZslZr_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 30/120

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current: Permanently Cursed by the head Feylord of the autumn courts. -4 to INT stat (Can be removed with wish, Was implemented upon player request at character  creation)

attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current:
I take great pride in both friendship and loyalty.

I love a good insult every now and then no matter who it's directed at.

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current:
Recklessness. Life is only worth living if you actually go out there an experience it and as such I am determined to go out there and live to the fullest.(Chaotic)

Compassion. The world isn't always the most friendly place so I do what I can to brighten up whenever I see the opportunity to.(Good)

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current:
I want to live a life so full of adventure that scholars will be talking about it for hundreds of years.

I have a fan who seems kind of obsessed with me and seems to show up at a good majority of my shows, she seems well but something about her creeps me out.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LZpZNnceDgBhEmlT74b_description
attribs.current: You can always find a place to perform, usually in an inn or tavern but possibly with a circus, at a theater, or even in a noble's court. At such a place, you receive free lodging and food of a modest or comfortable standard (depending on the quality of the establishment), as long as you perform each night. In addition, your performance makes you something of a local figure. When strangers recognize you in a town where you have performed, they typically take a liking to you.
